result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew R Gensler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intentionally Mistreat Animals [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 951.02.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:31 AM Defendant Matthew R Gensler in court in custody from DCJ.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Matthew R Gensler.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki in court for the State of Wisconsin. B. Bahr - Clerk 
22CF333, 22CF345, 22CM154, 22CM285, 22CM295

Atty Rivard - provides court with plea documents. There is a joint recommendation in all cases.

State - plea to Ct 1 in 22CF345 and 22CF333 Ct 2 in 22CF333 and Count 1 in 22CM285 and Count 1 in 22CF295. Remaining counts and 22CM154 will be DRI.  Ct 1 in 22CF345 and 22CF333  - wheld sent 3 years probation. No contact with ESD 5/2/97 except regarding the children and only electronically. Domestic violence programming. maintain absolute sobriety. follow programming recommended by agent. $638 costs on each of those counts.  Ct 2 in 22CF333 and 22CM285 wheld sent 2 years prob. No contact with ESD 5/2/97 except regarding the children and only electronically. domestic violence programming. Maintain absolute sobriety. follow programming costs $463 on each of those counts. Ct 1 22CM295 - 9 months jail. No objection to Huber. $463 costs. Victim rights have been complied with.

Atty Rivard - Prelim was waived in felony cases. No objection to proceed today as long as State filed Information. 
Parties stipulate to jail credit. 22CF345 - 24 days. 22CM295 - 20 days. 22CF333 - 18 days. 22CM285 - 21 days. 
DE - understands agreement.   Court - provides plea colloquy.  Parties stipulate to the facts.

DE - enters No Contest plea to Count 1 in 22CF345 and 22CF333. Enters No Contest plea to Count 2 in 22CF333 and Count 1 in 22CM285. Enters No Contest plea to Count 1 in 22CM295.
Court - finds waiver of rights voluntary plea free & knowing & approves stips to facts. Accepts plea and finds DE guilty.
State - asks court to accept joint recommendation. No PSI requested.  Atty Rivard - agrees court should accept joint recommendation. Asks that the 2 phones ceased be returned.  State - no objection.
DE - makes a statement to the court.
Court - orders phones ceased be returned. Asks clerk to add this to the JOC.
